alert.note: Alert for Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 5:24PM EDT until July 03 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Prince Georges County in central Maryland... Northwestern Charles County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Fairfax County in northern Virginia... East central Prince William County in northern Virginia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Woodbridge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Waldorf, Clinton, Fort Washington, Fort Hunt, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge, Lake Ridge, Lorton, Hybla Valley, Newington, Friendly, Saint Charles, Mount Vernon, Accokeek, Bryans Road, Brandywine, Mason Neck, Potomac Heights, Occoquan and Pomfret. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
